page.title: 05LANDSCAPE & BUILDINGS
page.content: {TRANENT DISTRICT COUNCIL'S }aim is to make the town a better place to live in.The by-pass will reduce traffic volume and shopkeepers are being encouraged to up-grade their property now that there will be less fumes and noise.{WEST WINDYGOUL}- The council own land here and application has been made for purchase by Castlerock Housing Association to build 38 sheltered houses and by Edinvar for 32 houses for handicapped or single persons.There is also proposals for a new primary school but with falling roles in schools this may not materialise.{HIGH STREET }- New hypermarket to be built by East Lothian Co-op.The location of the car park is under discussion. There are also plans to pedestrianise the main shopping area but again lack of funding restricts development.
